content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function show(io::IO, u::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, u.value, " ", u.unit)
end
```
This defines a `show` method for the `FloatWithUnits` struct that will concatenate the value and unit with a space. When you call `print` on an instance of this type, it will display the value and unit in the format "1.8 meters".
